comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -87,6 +87,14 @@ elseif(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR MATCHES "s390x")
     if(${OQS_DIST_BUILD})
         set(OQS_DIST_S390X_BUILD ON)
     endif()
+elseif(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR MATCHES "riscv")
+    if(BOARD MATCHES "qemu_riscv32")
comment.body: removed any board references in the root CMakeLists.txt!

Adds riscv32 support to the zephyr-rtos module.
<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->
This addresses Issue #1416.

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -2,10 +2,10 @@
 
 config LIBOQS
 	bool "Enable liboqs"
-	depends on ARM || ARM64 || X86 || ARCH_POSIX
+	depends on ARM || ARM64 || X86 || ARCH_POSIX || RISCV
 	help
 	  This option enables the liboqs as a Zephyr module. Currenty, the port is only
-	  available for ARM, ARM64, and x86 architectures and the native Posix simulators.
+	  available for ARM, ARM64, x86, RISCV-32, and RISCV-64 architectures and the native Posix simulators.
comment.body: Possibly silly question: Does "x86" also include "x86_64" ("x64")? Worthwhile adding to the documentation/help?

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -54,6 +54,7 @@ In this policy, the words "must" and "must not" specify absolute requirements th
 - x86_64/amd64/x64 for Windows 2022
 - armeabi-v7a, arm64-v8a, x86, x86_64 for Android
 - aarch64 for Apple iOS and tvOS (CMake `-DPLATFORM=OS64` and `TVOS`)
+- riscv32, riscv64 for Zephyr
comment.body: My suggestion then would be to add "Zephyr" to all HW platforms listed above and supported by Zephyr (possibly incl. "x64" as per separate comment).

pull_request.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
Adds riscv32 support to the zephyr-rtos module.
<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->
This addresses Issue #1416.
<!-- Any PR adding a new feature is expected to contain a test; the test should be part of CI testing, preferably within the ".github/workflows" directory tree. Please add an explanation to the PR if/when (why) this cannot be done. -->

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -2,10 +2,10 @@
 
 config LIBOQS
 	bool "Enable liboqs"
-	depends on ARM || ARM64 || X86 || ARCH_POSIX
+	depends on ARM || ARM64 || X86 || ARCH_POSIX || RISCV
 	help
 	  This option enables the liboqs as a Zephyr module. Currenty, the port is only
-	  available for ARM, ARM64, and x86 architectures and the native Posix simulators.
+	  available for ARM, ARM64, x86, RISCV-32, and RISCV-64 architectures and the native Posix simulators.
comment.body:
I just took a look at the Zephyr documentation and found x86_64 to be supported actually. Hence, setting `CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P` to 4 always is incorrect (my fault). 
I will take a look at that and publish a fix once back in the office.
